thag4.10:5.1: “Dhamma surely protects one who practices Dhamma;
thag4.10:5.2: the teaching brings happiness when practiced well.
thag4.10:5.3: This is the benefit of practicing Dhamma:
thag4.10:5.4: one doesn’t go to a bad destination.
thag4.10:6.1: It’s not the case that Dhamma and what is not Dhamma
thag4.10:6.3: What is not Dhamma leads to hell,
thag4.10:6.4: while Dhamma takes you to a good place.
thag4.10:7.1: So you should rouse enthusiasm for the teachings;
thag4.10:7.2: such rejoicing is owing to the Holy One, the poised.
thag4.10:7.3: The disciples of the best of Holy Ones are firm in the teaching;
thag4.10:7.4: those wise ones are led on, headed to the very best of refuges.”
thag4.10:8.1: “The boil has been burst from its root,
thag4.10:8.2: the net of craving is eradicated.
thag4.10:8.3: He has ended transmigration, he has nothing,
thag4.10:8.4: he’s like the full moon on a bright night.”
